thread.title: Iceland’s president’s strong views on pineapple pizza have caused a stir
thread.title_full: Iceland’s president’s strong views on pineapple pizza have caused a stir - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Iceland’s president’s strong views on pineapple pizza have caused a stir
text:
This non-pineapple pizza would likely be fine by the president of Iceland.
AP February 22, 2017
REYKJAVIK, Iceland (AP) — Iceland’s president’s strong views on pizza have caused an international stir.
Gudni Th. Johannesson disclosed his opposition to pineapple on pizza to Icelandic high school students last week. Icelandic media reported that he said he’d ban the fruity topping if he could.
Advertisement
It proved Johannesson’s most controversial statement since he took up the largely ceremonial post last year.
Amid a social-media storm, Johannesson released a statement on Facebook, stressing that he does not have the power to ban pizza toppings, and is ‘‘glad that I do not hold such power.’’
Get The Weekender in your inbox: The Globe's top picks for what to see and do each weekend, in Boston and beyond. The former history professor says he ‘‘would not want to hold this position if I could pass laws forbidding that which I don’t like. I would not want to live in such a country.’’
For pizza, however, ‘‘I recommend seafood.’’
